maml:description.maml:para: Gets the details of an event subscription, or gets a list of all event subscriptions in the current Azure subscription.

The Get-AzureRmEventGridSubscription cmdlet gets either the details of a specified Event Grid subscription, or a list of all Event Grid subscriptions in the current Azure subscription or resource group. If the event subscription name is provided, the details of a single Event Grid subscription is returned. If the event subscription name is not provided, a list of all event subscriptions is returned.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the event subscription
Resource Group Name.
EventGrid Topic Name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Include the full endpoint URL of the event subscription destination.
The name of the event subscription
Identifier of the resource to which event subscriptions have been created.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Include the full endpoint URL of the event subscription destination.
Resource Group Name.
TopicType name
Location
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Include the full endpoint URL of the event subscription destination.
EventGrid Event Subscription object.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
The name of the event subscription
Include the full endpoint URL of the event subscription destination.
EventGrid Event Subscription object.
Location
Resource Group Name.
Identifier of the resource to which event subscriptions have been created.
EventGrid Topic Name.
TopicType name

maml:description.maml:para: Parameters: InputObject (ByValue)

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventGridSubscription -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -TopicName Topic1 -EventSubscriptionName EventSubscription1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the details of event subscription `EventSubscription1` created for topic `Topic1` in resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventGridSubscription -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -TopicName Topic1 -EventSubscriptionName EventSubscription1 -IncludeFullEndpointUrl

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the details of event subscription `EventSubscription1` created for topic `Topic1` in resource group `MyResourceGroupName`, including the full endpoint URL if it is a webhook based event subscription.
Get a list of all the event subscriptions created for topic `Topic1` in resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.
Gets the details of event subscription `EventSubscription1` created for resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.
Gets the details of event subscription `EventSubscription1` created for the currently selected Azure subscription.
Gets the list of all global event subscriptions created under the resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.
Gets the list of all global event subscriptions created under the currently selected Azure subscription.
Gets the list of all regional event subscriptions created under resource group `MyResourceGroupName` in the specified location `westus2`.
Gets the list of all event subscriptions created for the specified EventHub namespace.
Gets the list of all event subscriptions created for the specified topic type (EventHub namespaces) in the specified location.
Gets the list of all event subscriptions created for the specific resource group.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the details of an Event Grid topic, or gets a list of all Event Grid topics in the current Azure subscription.

The Get-AzureRmEventGridTopic cmdlet gets either the details of a specified Event Grid Topic, or a list of all Event Grid topics in the current Azure subscription. If the topic name is provided, the details of a single Event Grid Topic is returned. If the topic name is not provided, a list of topics is returned.

maml:Description.maml:para: Resource Group Name.
EventGrid Topic Name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Resource Group Name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Resource Identifier representing the Event Grid Topic.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
EventGrid Topic Name.
Resource Group Name.
Resource Identifier representing the Event Grid Topic.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the details of Event Grid topic `Topic1` in resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.
Gets the details of Event Grid topic `Topic1` in resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.
List all the Event Grid topics in resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.
List all the Event Grid topics in the subscription.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the shared access keys used to publish events to an Event Grid topic.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the shared access keys of Event Grid topic `Topic1` in resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventGridTopic -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroupName -Name Topic1 | Get-AzureRmEventGridTopicKey

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the shared access keys of Event Grid topic `Topic1` in resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the details about the topic types supported by Azure Event Grid.

Gets the details of topic types supported by Azure Event Grid. If a topic type name is specified, details about that topic type are returned. If a topic type name is not specified, details about all topic types are returned. If IncludeEventTypes is specified, information about event types supported by each topic type is included in the response.

maml:Description.maml:para: EventGrid Topic Type Name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
If specified, the response will include the event types supported by a topic type.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
If specified, the response will include the event types supported by a topic type.
EventGrid Topic Type Name.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets a list of the topic types.
Gets information about the StorageAccounts topic type.
Gets information about the StorageAccounts topic type, including the event types supported by StorageAccounts.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Azure Event Grid Event Subscription to a topic, Azure resource, Azure subscription or Resource Group.

Create a new event subscription to an Azure Event Grid topic, a supported Azure resource, an Azure subscription or Resource Group. To create an event subscription to the currently selected Azure subscription, specify the event subscription name and the destination endpoint. To create an event subscription to a resource group, specify the resource group name in addition to the event subscription name and the destination endpoint. To create an event subscription to an Azure Event Grid topic, specify the topic name as well. To create an event subscription to a supported Azure resource, specify the full resource ID of the resource. To view the list of supported types, run the Get-AzureRmEventGridTopicType cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the event subscription
Event subscription destination endpoint. This can be a webhook URL or the Azure resource ID of an EventHub.
The resource group of the topic.
Endpoint Type. This can be webhook or eventhub
Filter that specifies that only events matching the specified subject prefix will be included. If not specified, events with all subject prefixes will be included.
Filter that specifies that only events matching the specified subject suffix will be included. If not specified, events with all subject suffixes will be included.
Filter that specifies a list of event types to include.If not specified, all event types will be included.
Labels for the event subscription
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Filter that specifies that the subject field should be compared in a case sensitive manner. If not specified, subject will be compared in a case insensitive manner.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventGridSubscription -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroup -TopicName Topic1 -Endpoint https://requestb.in/19qlscd1 -EventSubscriptionName EventSubscription1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new event subscription `EventSubscription1` to an Azure Event Grid topic `Topic1` in resource group `MyResourceGroupName` with the webhook destination endpoint https://requestb.in/19qlscd1. This event subscription uses default filters.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventGridSubscription -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroupName -Endpoint https://requestb.in/19qlscd1 -EventSubscriptionName EventSubscription1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new event subscription `EventSubscription1` to a resource group `MyResourceGroupName` with the webhook destination endpoint https://requestb.in/19qlscd1. This event subscription uses default filters.

Creates a new event subscription `EventSubscription1` to the currently selected Azure subscription with the webhook destination endpoint https://requestb.in/19qlscd1. This event subscription uses default filters.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $includedEventTypes = "Microsoft.Resources.ResourceWriteFailure", "Microsoft.Resources.ResourceWriteSuccess" PS C:\> $labels = "Finance", "HR" PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventGridSubscription -Endpoint https://requestb.in/19qlscd1 -EventSubscriptionName EventSubscription1 -SubjectBeginsWith "TestPrefix" -SubjectEndsWith "TestSuffix" -IncludedEventType $includedEventTypes -Label $labels

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new event subscription `EventSubscription1` to the currently selected Azure subscription with the webhook destination endpoint https://requestb.in/19qlscd1. This event subscription specifies the additional filters for event types and subject, and only events matching those filters will be delivered to the destination endpoint.

Creates a new event subscription `EventSubscription1` to the currently selected Azure subscription with the specified event hub as the destination for events. This event subscription uses default filters.

Creates a new event subscription `EventSubscription1` to an EventHub namespace with the specified webhhok destination endpoint https://requestb.in/19qlscd1. This event subscription uses default filters.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Azure Event Grid Topic.
Creates a new Azure Event Grid Topic. Once the topic is created, an application can publish events to the topic endpoint.

maml:Description.maml:para: The resource group in which the topic should be created.
The name of the topic.
The location of the topic
Hashtables which represents resource Tags.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
The location of the topic
The name of the topic.
The resource group in which the topic should be created.
Hashtables which represents resource Tags.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventGridTopic -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -Name Topic1 -Location westus2

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates an Event Grid topic `Topic1` in the specified geographic location `westus2`, in resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventGridTopic -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -Name Topic1 -Location westus2 -Tag @{ Department="Finance"; Environment="Test" }

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates an Event Grid topic `Topic1` in the specified geographic location `westus2`, in resource group `MyResourceGroupName` with the specified tags "Department" and "Environment".

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventGridTopicKey -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroupName -TopicName Topic1 -KeyName key1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Regenerate the key corresponding to key \'key1'\ of Event Grid topic `Topic1` in resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventGridTopic -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroupName -Name Topic1 | New-AzureRmEventGridTopicKey -KeyName "key1"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Regenerate the key corresponding to key \'key1'\ of Event Grid topic `Topic1` in resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Remove-AzureRmEventGridSubscription -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroup -TopicName Topic1 -EventSubscriptionName EventSubscription1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the event subscription `EventSubscription1` to an Azure Event Grid topic `Topic1` in resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

Removes the event subscription `EventSubscription1` to an Event Hub namespace.

command:example.maml:title: Example 5
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventGridTopic -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroup -TopicName Topic1 | Remove-AzureRmEventGridSubscription -EventSubscriptionName EventSubscription1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the event subscription `EventSubscription1` to an Event Grid Topic.

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-AzureRmEventGridTopic -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroupName -Name Topic1 -Tag @{ Department="Finance"; Environment="Test" }

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the properties of the Event Grid topic `Topic1` in resource group `MyResourceGroupName` to replace the tags with the specified tags "Department" and "Environment".

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Update-AzureRmEventGridSubscription -EventSubscriptionName ES1 -TopicName Topic1 -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroupName -Endpoint https://requestb.in/1kxxoui1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the endpoint of the event subscription `ES1` for topic `Topic1` in resource group `MyResourceGroupName` to `https://requestb.in/1kxxoui1`

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventGridSubscription -EventSubscriptionName ES1 -TopicName Topic1 -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroupName | Update-AzureRmEventGridSubscription -Endpoint https://requestb.in/1kxxoui1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the endpoint of the event subscription `ES1` for topic `Topic1` in resource group `MyResourceGroupName` to `https://requestb.in/1kxxoui1`
Updates the properties of the event subscription `ES1` for the EventHub namespace ContosoNamespace with the new endpoint as `https://requestb.in/1kxxoui1` and the new SubjectEndsWith filter as `jpg`

command:example.maml:title: Example 4
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $labels = "Finance", "HR" PS C:\> Update-AzureRmEventGridSubscription -EventSubscriptionName ES1 -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroupName -Label $labels

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the properties of the event subscription `ES1` for the resource group `MyResourceGroupName` with the new labels $labels.
